website_summaries.verdict: If you have a larger, heavier TV, it's worth it to spend a bit more on this durable mount.
pros: Durable, heavy-gauge steel construction effortlessly holds TVs up to 165 pounds
Can tilt, swivel, and rotate in any direction
cons: A little tight at first, but it loosens up after a few turns and twists

website_summaries.verdict: Currently the best TV mount on the market. If you have a larger, heavier TV, it's worth it to spend a bit more on such a durable mount.
pros: Its durable heavy gauge steel construction can effortlessly hold TV's up to 165 pounds
Can tilt, swivel, and rotate in any direction
cons: It is a little tight at first, but it loosens up after a few turns and twists

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP BOLTS! ACCIDENT WAITING TO HAPPEN!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage quality! Shady at best. Most of these positive reviews are for a different mode mount. This one comes with cheap bolts that snapped off while tightening even before the bold was even making contact with the mount. This is a HUGE safety hazard!! I predrilled the pilot holes as instructed, then used a wrench to screw the bolt in. It still snapped! This is a massive accident waiting to happen. Look up bolt grade guide, these are ungraded and cheapest quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Ace

customer_reviews.title: I concur.  This is a different mount than most of the reviews are for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mount in 2013. Love it its amazing. I came back to this page to see about getting new brackets for my TV because i misplaced them. When i found my purchase, june 2013, i was sent to this product. NOTHING like the one i have. The one i have, just by looks alone, is a superior design and can extend much further. I would check reviews of purchases from the last year as i have no idea when they switched.
customer_reviews.author: Matty P

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This TV mount is great. Easy to set up and very strong. Took me about 30 minutes to install from start to finish. Great material and it's nice that they send a HDMI cable with it, never hurts to have an extra one of those. Downside is that one of the mount bolts was bent and I was not about to put it in the wall through the mount. Fortunately the 2 other bolts were strong enough to hold up my tv. Would have been nice to have the 3rd bolt for extra stability but I feel like the 2 will suffice. Recommend for sure but kind of a bummer about the bolt
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Davis

customer_reviews.title: Swinging arms are not parallel
customer_reviews.text: The arm that comes from the wall and the arm that comes from the back of the TV are not perfectly parallel. If I were to install the wall bracket to the wall in perfect level then my TV would be crooked. To make the TV level I would have to install the wall bracket at an angle. Not only is this a workaround I shouldn't have to do, but the arms not being perfectly perpendicular from the wall to the TV could prove to be a nuisance. Perhaps I got a bad unit, but I've returned it and have since found an option that has worked out better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible, Product was changed
customer_reviews.text: The X pattern the wall mount makes covered up the electrical outlet for the TV. So it was not functional. This product listing was originally a different rectangular style which would have worked (shown in other pictures), which is why the ratings are so high. They kept the same listing and changed the product. Did not work for Panasonic Viera 46" P46ST30
customer_reviews.author: knight5

customer_reviews.title: Weak Design
customer_reviews.text: It is taking me a long time to set up. In my opinion, the product has several major design problems. First, it was a much better design if it had two bars instead of one getting attached to the wall. It would had been much more stable. Second, the screws are way longer than the plastics, so you cannot screw then completely. Third, it's difficult to attach the surface to the TV (at least to my 49" LG TV). I looked at all these positive reviews and bought the product, but I'm not happy at all. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own screws, trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Really crappy screws - the hex heads fit no socket (English or metric) precisely and the Phillips screwdriver head stripped out about 1/3 of the way into the pilot hole. I ended up having to use Vice Grips to finish screwing it in and wasn't that a joy - took me 45 minutes per screw (clamp, turn 1/4 turn, unclamp, rinse, repeat about a hundred times each). The mount itself isn't awful, but really, how much more would it cost to put high-quality mounting screws in there?
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to align and install. Looks good. Works well for years.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this mount twice. My first purchase was three years ago (the second was last week). While I initially believed the mount was too light, it has proven durable. The installation is simple and allows for an initial mistake in vertical alignment. Drill two pilot holes in either a wood wall stud or masonry (I've done it both ways) and use the included fasteners and level to plumb the bracket against the wall. The bottom hole of the mount is slotted, which allows for vertical adjustment. There's no other adjustment necessary. The rest of the assembly is obvious. The mount comes with picture-instructions, a level, an HDMI cable, and multiple size screws to attach the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K

customer_reviews.title: Good tv mount.
customer_reviews.text: Overall. It’s a great tv mount. Installation is easier with 2 people. Bought 2 for 2 rooms. My dad and I takes about 45 minutes on first one. And about 30 minutes on second one. It feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Vo

customer_reviews.title: WEAK SCREWS BROKE MY TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and received it immediately. When I got it I connected the frame to the walls with the screws it came with. Connected the brackets to the TV and hung it. As we started to lower the bracket/tv to the frame we heard a crack. Putting the tv down a little slower the screws had broken in half and the TV fell. The screws were cheap and now I have a crack on the bottom left of my TV I had to return it immediately and went to Best Buy to get a new mount.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Samara

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few extra dollars and get a quality product
customer_reviews.text: This product isn't bad, but I wouldn't have bought it off I had known how hard the adjustments were going to be. I've got a 40 inch TV mounted, and while it hasn't come crashing down {buy your own bolts from home depot, trust me, $1 is worth the headache. I used 1/4 X 3in bolts and it's solid} the adjustments to move the screen back against the wall are hard to do one handed. The tilt ability makes the TV not quite flat, and the lock plate isn't quite secure so the TV can rotate around clock and counter clock wise. Would spend more money next time and buy a better quality mount
customer_reviews.author: James Wadsley

customer_reviews.title: I installed directly to the drywall
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, in my home all the studs are metal. I found easiest way to installed it just directly in the wall with 2 TOGGLER BB 1/4"-20 Heavy-Duty Wall Anchors. No problem handle it my 48 Samsung tv. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Samo

customer_reviews.title: It's great really.  Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Had a 43" Samsung TV in the bedroom. Mounting holes were 200x200mm. Used a VideoSecu mount on my smaller 32" in the basement (got the small mount model), and that worked out so nicely that I bought the next size up for the bedroom. The main difference on this size was an extra bolt into the stud. Overall I was extremely happy with this. The parts kit it comes with is just this amazing assortment of sizes of screws and spacers that literally would have to suffice for any conceivable TV. All metal construction. Thrilled. Two VideoSecu units, and two absolutely thrilling results. Exactly what I wanted. Exactly what you want too. Order now!
customer_reviews.author: DrKK

customer_reviews.title: will not fit
customer_reviews.text: yes sturdy build.......NO, will NOT fit a 55 inch LG flat screen. needs spacers, when call the manufacturer about it they said to go to the hardware store and get spacers ourselves. our pattern is a 12x12 and no mater what config pattern we tried it STILL WOULD NOT FIT. stay away from this mount if you have a 55 inch LG with a 12x12 pattern. also, called the company and they answered like they were sitting at home.
customer_reviews.author: gravedigger

customer_reviews.title: Does not center TV over stud
customer_reviews.text: I need a single stud mount for my tv so that it is centered between two exposed beams. I was impressed at first then after I got it hung on the wall I realized the mount plate is 3 to 4 inches right or left of the stud center with no way I can figure to adjust it. It was not apparent from the product pics this was going to be an issue. Back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: Mach1run

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it!! Solid quality but use different wall mounting screws for drywall
customer_reviews.text: Once set up properly, this works very well and allows many different TV viewing angles. It feels and seems very sturdy. I would use a extra screws when mounting it on the wall for extra attachment strength, especially if you're using it with a larger TV. I didn't use the wall bolts included but bought screws with anchors from the hardware store that were rated to hold 68lbs per screw - I used 8 screws (5 on top, 3 on bottom). I'm probably being overly cautious but the wall bolts that come with it may be finicky with drywall, especially if there's no stud to attach it to. It was somewhat easy to set up. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CAHS

customer_reviews.title: Not What is Pictured
customer_reviews.text: This is a completely different mount than what is pictured. The mounting brackets are garbage and I now have 3 3/8 inch holes in my TV and 3 brackets that won't expand. This will be going back tomorrow. Clean up your act Amazon. If you recommend something at least verify that is what you're selling,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: This wall mount is extremely sturdy and easy to put together. The directions are easy to follow and every tool you need is provided in the box. The same quality at a Big Box store would cost three times as much. I hung a 47" Samsung with it and it has great viewing maneuverability. Leaves plenty room for for TV sets with backward facing inputs. No more taking the TV down to rearrange connections.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at half the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sturdy TV mount that wouldn't cost almost as much as my TV and I came across this one. It's great quality, very sturdy and pretty easy to install. I had no trouble with actually mounting this to the wall, but I did have a little bit of difficulty getting the tilt of the TV correct and the bolts tight enough to keep it at that angle. With a little patience, I eventually got it exactly how I want it and it has stayed in place for several months now. I definitely recommend saving a few bucks on this mount instead of going with one that's nearly double the price from an electronics store.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Best TV Wall Mount
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It comes packed neatly and organized. It weighs around 25 pounds, which makes it sturdy enough to handle the larger TVs. In other reviews I saw people were complaining that it couldn't handle 2ft (24in) stud spacing. This is FAKE NEWS! It can absolutely handle 16in, 18in, and 24in. Take a look at the pics I took. One of them shows it up against a tape measure. This mount can do everything it advertises on the Amazon link. It extends out, swivels, tilts, and can correct imperfect leveling. Give it a try, you wont be disappointed (unless you cant read or follow instructions).
customer_reviews.author: Dude Man

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS (Cheap screws)
customer_reviews.text: Nightmare! Injured myself trying to mount this. The screws are weak and cheap. Been to the hardware store 3 times to get more screws/bolts after they stripped. The ones for the TV were too short. Then we got it on the wall in the studs and it fell off the wall. The cheap screws came out the wall. I injured my back catching my 40 inch TV. Past the window to return. Most horrible purchase thus far on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Empire

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE for a Quality TV Mount
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a 43 inch TV in our kids playroom and it's great. Easy to move around and no worries about the sturdiness of the TV. So glad I got this on Amazon since local stores don't carry anything near this price range. Asked the sales rep at a local tech store what the difference in their TV mounts which were all over $100 and the many that were on Amazon for under $50. He said honestly nothing. So I came on Amazon and bought 3 TV mounts and all are great.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRODUCT IN AMAZON PURCHASE HISTORY.
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE! It’s been 2 HOURS with TWO PEOPLE on CONSTRUCTION and this damn thing is still not up. Extremely difficult to put up especially if you are trying to hang high. You need about 4 hands. Two to hold it sturdy and have the leveled up against it and two to screw in. If you mark it and follow instructions it keeps becoming I level even when you have marked it level. Very irritating and HARD TO INSTALL. I would recommend this to ANY DIY er! F- ING TERRIBLE! We are still trying to hang the damn thing!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: HennahLuv

customer_reviews.title: WAY too complicated and awkward to assemble. Screwing the ...
customer_reviews.text: WAY too complicated and awkward to assemble. Screwing the tv was such a task and it took 3 people to hold and screw in!! Does not seem secure and the tv moves too much that sometimes it looks crooked and you have to keep adjusting it. It's only been 2 days and I fear it will fall any min. The price is definitely not worth the hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, especially for a corner.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in the living room with a 30, 60, 90 triangle to work through. Installation to the wall wad very easy, but the weight of it, does make it easier with two people to mount it to the wall. To attach the tv, having two people there also, to make sure you are lined up with the rails. We had to add the additional standoffs for our tv, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to mount it. Had to dry fit it twice, then it was ready to go. After it was all operational, the cable management and swivel are great for maintaining the tv and cables. Well and solid design. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Asches

customer_reviews.title: This puches above its expected class, but you may need to BYO washers.
customer_reviews.text: This was great, and holds way bigger TVs than it looks like it would. The good: - You only need to find one stud. - The TV gets very close to the wall - Extra pieces included for mounting TVs with wider distances between screw holes The bad: - The included washers don't fit one of the included screw styles. I had to go get slightly larger ones at a hardware store. If your TV doesn't use those screws (they provide a wide variety), you may be in luck.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Broke my Tv
customer_reviews.text: I had a 48" Tv. I thought surely a mount made for tvs up to 55" can support it. I was wrong. I followed the directions to the T. Drilled the pilot holes into the stud. Used the included crappy wrench thing. Put flat piece on the back of the tv, put the tv gently on the rest of the mount, just for it to fall down on my drill and break my TV. Amazing how this $25 mount cost me $350 in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Lo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good product
customer_reviews.text: Add first I was intimidated by all of the hardware then I realized it was to fit many TV sizes. Putting it on the wall was easy because of the magnetic stud finder that was included i knew I was getting it mounted on the right spot. When my TV came it took five mins to mount the backing and only another to mount the television. All together it was about a 30 minute install time. The range of motion is great and it sits flat against the wall and about 12 inches out of wanted the tilt and sway is nice and can be adjusted. I got a 50 inch Samsung 4K
customer_reviews.author: Cindy.Mcg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I own four of these for different sized TVs mounted to different materials, from concrete to drywall. These mounts are sturdy and ideally adjustable. The price is right for the versatility and durability. I cannot find anything negative to say about this product. People who give this product fewer than 5 stars either had a problem with shipping (which has nothing to do with the product itself), or they simply cannot follow the clear-cut directions on how to install it. If you are looking to mount a TV to a wall and want full range of motion and the ability to retract it tight against the wall, then this is the mount for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: HIGH QUALITY, GREAT VALUE, EASY TO INSTALL!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing TV mount for this price! It comes with several different screws/adapters/instructions for all different types of TV’s so it was easy to find mine. We have hung TV mounts before and anticipated a headache but this one was so easy. The instructions are clearly written and easy to follow. This DOES NOT feel like a $25 TV mount-it rivals any big box store quality and may even surpass it. I am 100% happy with this purchase and will order more for other rooms in my home. Buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this for my Roku tv. I also paid through Amazon, for someone to come and install it. They did a great job and was very professional. For $99 more they also drilled my walls and put the cords behind the wall, which is very important to me. And they did not leave a mess, cleaned up after they were done and explained everything they were doing. I hate to see TV's on the wall and the cords hanging. Looks really tacky! I would have this service done again.
customer_reviews.author: H. Thompkins

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for what you pay for. The design won't be great if you have an older, thicker, haeavier TV, but with all tvs becoming thinner and lighter, I can't foresee this one being too weak for and of the ones it's made to fit. I like that you can bend it s it can face any way you want, or push or pull it out if you want it flat against the wall, or hanging out closer towards you, it also allows you to tilt it down wards a little with the loosening of a bolt. It isn't perfect though, if you wigge your TV, you can see it wiggle, but nothing that will necessarily break it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin lam

customer_reviews.title: False advertising. Read 1 star reviews. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of time. Ordered 2 of these mounts for my 47" tvs and imagine my surprise when i'm on the last step only to find that the mount does not line up even with the adapters. The item states 25"-55" and last i checked 47" should be well within that range. Upon reading more reviews in search of a solution it becomes evident that a ridiculous amount of people are dealing with the same issue. Now i have 3 holes in my wall for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Solid mount but low quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I was fairly pleased with this mount once it was installed. The arm extends easily and is helpful when wiring components. Installation was less pleasing though, as the hardware that comes with the mount is of extremely low quality. The bolts holding the mount to the wall begin to round almost immediately and ended in a few bloodied knuckles. Additonally, the pieces holding the angle adjustment can come loose if you aren't careful and are very difficult to retighten fully. Despite the frustrating installation, the mount seems very secure now holding a 32" TV. The product included a ton of hardware for mounting different sized TVs or monitors and was very well packaged with clear instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: 5 years old. Jusy outlasted the tv it was holding
customer_reviews.text: 5 years I've been using this mount and it officially outlasted the tv it was holding. It's been moved once to a different wall and has definitely been swiveled as far as it could go. 5 years later and it does appear to be leaning down a bit. But I've got to admit. I'm incredibly impressed and will likely buy another for the next new tv. Little bit of work to Install and now cant remember how to get the old tv down. But I give this high recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Use it to hold my 55” LG UHD TV 4K 2017. I have a sectional couch and I wanted the option of moving my tv if I wanted depending on where I wanted to Netflix and chill with my girlfriend. It extremely easy to set up I actually did it by myself, the only thing I needed help with was lifting my tv to get it on the mount so I suggest you call over a strong buddy when you’ve finished placing the mount where you want.. unless you want to take the chance of doing it alone ...may the odds be ever in your favour... and can you make sure to record that attempt 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Bracket only usable on 16 inch center studs...
customer_reviews.text: Used the item to hang a 46” LED TV...my biggest complaint is the support bracket will only fit on 16 inch studs...most interior walls are on 24 inch centers...thus to use this on an interior wall you need to put a separate support board or bracket to attach the TV bracket to...a pain and a step that shouldn’t be needed...the bracket should function on both 16 and 24 inch center studs...Had I known this up front I would have selected a different bracket and saved my self the additional grief...
customer_reviews.author: sweetpea9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mount
customer_reviews.text: I researched several tv mounts and actually purchased three different mounts (one was returned the other two mounted two separate tvs). The VideoSecu model#BCLMW480B was the best mount by far! it is very sturdy and well designed. In addition, it was very easy to install (the wall mount plate was large enough to span several studs and easily attached to those studs using the included lag bolts. Only drawback is that the mount is quite heavy and requires two people to install (one to hold it up and another to secure lag bolts). Overall - I highly recommend this mount and would not question purchasing one of these mounts again or recommending this mount to anyone mounting a tv.
customer_reviews.author: Greg the Engineer

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I've ever bought a product that was so complete with hardware for every conceivable mounting option. I used it to mount a 32" TV on my patio into brick. I figured it would only have hardware for mounting into drywall and that I'd need to go buy screws and anchors for masonry. Nope. It came with that hardware, and even included a level, an HDMI cable, and wrenches. Well done, and it works like a charm. I wish every product was this complete. It's a steal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: scottincarmel

customer_reviews.title: Product dimensions and design have changed
customer_reviews.text: I second the other recent reviews. Don't blame seller, but this is my second one and I made sure the product model was the same but manufacturer (Videosecu) has changed design while keeping same part number (MW380B3). Back plate is shorter, tv doesn't extend as far, and level adjustment is not as smooth as previous design.
customer_reviews.author: alfri

customer_reviews.title: Good mount for Smaller TVs
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these, one for a 42" and one for a 55" TV. Works great for the 42" TV, haven't had any problems. For my 55", however, it is a bit too heavy for it. The TV is within the weight limit according to the package, but I'm nervous when I move it and if I don't tighten down the bolt REALLY hard for the tilt then sometimes it slips when I'm just trying to move the TV. Perfect for the price for the smaller TVs but I would pick something a bit stronger for a 55".
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product !!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use it for our master bedroom tv,works great and does the job!!!! I really like that you have the options to pull the TV in position you need and you can push it back against the wall out of your way.Its not hard to install but you will need some help once the TV is on the mounting and you have to attache it to the wall unit, you need some one to hold The TV while other persons screw the bolts tougher that’s all!!!! Instruction is cleare to read! Comes whit all you need to install it,except the stud finder. Great product for great price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws, but otherwise heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY, but to me that translates to heavy duty. No flimsy construction and fairly easy to assemble with an incredible assortment of bolts. The screws to install into the wall are cheap and stripped out as is the case with most included screws, but that shouldn’t be an issue if you’re willing to use hand tools for that portion. The arm is a little stiff. I’m sure it will loosen up with use, but to be honest, the stiffness helps it hold its position very well. All in all, great buy for $20 to lead your eye up the wall and save space in a small room :)
customer_reviews.author: Kathrynne Willhoite

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a Roku 40" LCD T.V. and needed a wall mount. The sales person where I bought the T.V. told me to go to Amazon because of the massive price markup in the store. The Roku wanted a ridiculous overkill weight bearing capacity before they would honor their warranty. This mount, met the Roku weight bearing requirement and has great pull out/angle adjustment capability while meeting the wife's "I want it to get close to the wall and be inconspicuous when we're not watching it" requirement . The instructions for mounting to the wall were clear and the actual process took less than 1/2 hour from start to set down and turn on the T.V. Not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Reese

customer_reviews.title: Read this if your TV has a 200x300 mm pattern
customer_reviews.text: Mount is decent quality; great for the price. If you have a TV with a 200x300 mm pattern, but the mounting location is not centered on the back of the TV, you will have to mount it as shown in the photo in order to avoid having the arms protrude from the bottom of your TV. Took me a while to figure out; thought I would share.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Scott

customer_reviews.title: DON’T USE THE WALL STUD LAG SCREWS PROVIDED!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this mount for an 86” LG tv. Everything works as well as to be expected...except when it came to the final 2 1/2” lag screw into the wall stud...it broke off right at the head after the entire 2 1/2” was securely in the stud. It took me three hours to get the broken screw out so that I could put in the fourth and final screw. Go to your hardware store and get a 5/16” lag screw that is rated above 5 for hardness. Then throw away the cheap screws that come with the mount.
customer_reviews.author: GLMamerow

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed installation instructions & provides a variety of hardware to work on a range of TVs. Altogether took less than a half hour to install. The level in the stud finder isnt quite perfect, but we had one in our toolbag to use. Absolutely no complaints, I'm using it for a 50" Hisense TV and it looks great! When I'm ready to hang my smaller TV in my bedroom, I'll be buying another!
customer_reviews.author: Lia Luna

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend.. Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part of this installation is securing to wall. My installation was on a basement panel wall. Using my stud finder I was able to pinpoint the middle of the stud. I drilled my pilot holes and secured to wall with all necessary hardware. Next I attached the face plate to back of my LG 50PV450 Plasma television. Take care that screws used are correct length. With help of my sons, they lifted in onto bracket. I firmly attached screws to complete the installation. This process taken an hour and half... Very.. Very Happy
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Burgh

customer_reviews.title: very long reach, but abysmal assembly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mount to get my 49" gaming monitor mounted separate from a sim racing frame. I needed something with at least a 2 foot reach from the wall though to keep my field of view. After looking over specs for several pages of mounts here, I decided on this unit as it was pretty cheap and promised good reach along with the VESA pattern I needed. Where things go really wrong is assembling the large secondary ears on to the primary plate. it's just a nightmare. not well designed at all. In good conscience, I just cannot review it 5 starts with the assembly as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Erik A. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like about this product is mounting it where the TV has to be perfectly spaced or centered is hard to do. It should be as easy as closing the mount to the wall and that’s where the center of the tv will be. For whatever that didn’t work out for me that way. But I have left my tv mounted Inside of the camper and drove a few hundred miles and it stayed strong, no signs of bending, breaking, or the screws backing out
customer_reviews.author: Efred25

customer_reviews.title: Finally a company that does DIY right!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed the packaging for this product needs a major raise! All DIY projects should follow the lead of this company. Well designed unit, easy to put together, all the parts and tools needed are included with clear instructions and diagrams IN ENGLISH. But the best part was the way they packaged all the parts in one long strip with each compartment labeled with the part number that matches the instructions. You'd have to be blind to screw this up. Bravo for setting a great example got other manufacturers to follow.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Very good but go oversized
customer_reviews.text: Good design but go oversize for whatever TV you are mounting. If you have a 50" LED, the mount should hold up to (at least) a 70" TV. If you have a 70" TV or any of the older, (heavy) Plasma TV's over 40", get the strongest, heavy weight unit you can buy. They have a tendency to droop if you don't. If you can't line up to at least one wooden stud and have to use drywall anchors, go overkill with heavy duty (mushroom head) toggle bolt anchors or equivalent. (70 lb weight capacity per anchor minimum) Do not trust "twist n lock" type anchors
customer_reviews.author: REO Capital

customer_reviews.title: Wall mount Visio Ech32-C1 32” flat screen.
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for good sturdy TV wall mount single stud solution with good reviews. The VideoSecu ML531BE2 meets my needs. First reason why not five stars is due to the cheap screws. Other than that the product is great. Looks like the product may have changed in prior years but the product I received in 1/5/2020 is heavy duty, sturdy, and has a full range of motion. All the adjustments for range are done by adjusting a 10mm bolt. Instructions were a bit confusing and the technical writer should revisit these. Now other reviews had problems with leveling but with a 32” 12lb Flat screen there are no problems for me. Thank you VideoSecu for a good solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Vintag54

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Mount is good and easy to install. The screws aren’t great though. The reason for two stars is the abysmal customer service. The HDMI cable I received with this mount was broken. I requested a new one, and they would not replace it at all. They wanted me to send it back, so they could test it. They wouldn’t provide me a shipping label. They were not helpful in the slightest. They claim that the HDMI cord is a gift item, but it isn’t listed like that in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Vullo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible TV Mount. Read this before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible TV mount, after setting it up and installed a 65" it constantly puts itself off level and needs to be constantly adjusted. It's as if the TV is too heavy for it, but well within the weight recommended for it. So unless you want the hassle of constantly adjusting a tv to make sure it's leveled, steer clear of this bracket. Extremely disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great Mount!!
customer_reviews.text: sony 85" solid monster support. smooth pull out if need to adjust something in back. one of the best mounts available. highly reccomend when u compare to brick and mortar unit.. it's less expensive and seemingly more solid.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miano

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to install, does thee job, good price
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda skeptical when I first looked at this thing in the box, but I gotta say it works great, holds my 50 monitor perfectly. Installation was easy, once you know the trick to soap up the bolts before driving them into the studs. This system is very basic, and thus the range of motion is relatively limited, but it meets ALL of my needs and did so inexpensively.
customer_reviews.author: R. KellyTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, easy to mount, easy to move around, thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very straightforward and solidly built mount. I ordered it to install in a shipping container that I converted into a bedroom overseas. It needed a socket wrench and a drill to install but it was nothing complicated. It did come with a wide variety of hardware to accommodate all possible types of TVs to be mounted. It even came with a little level which I saved and will throw in my desk drawer for those odd little moments where I need to level something. But yeah, I was totally satisfied with it and would buy again if the need arose for a similar application.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Instructions!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are useless. Not only are they in broken English that make no sense but they are not even clear. The instructions are in imperial measurements, but the actual hardware is in metric, so I was not able to use a socket wrench as instructed and had to manually tighten into the stud with an adjustable spanner, as the spanner provided was very weak and eventually started wearing down. I ended up getting the tv mounted but only after 4 hours of frustration and some DIY. If you do buy this please save yourself the headache and pay for installation.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.  Adjustment for viewing angle is weak.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked most about this mount is how sturdy it feels. I felt like I could put my entire body weight on it (around 178 lbs), which I almost did but stopped short of hanging on it. The magnetic stud finder is almost useless (better use a battery operated stud finder instead). The worst part of this mount is the adjustment for the viewing angle. It is very finicky and does not hold too well. I could live with that weakness, and would rather have a strong mount that can be relied upon to hold a TV over time. This one does that job and does it quite well.
customer_reviews.author: V. Williams

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me
customer_reviews.text: When looking at products on Amazon, I tend to only look at the negative reviews with the thought people will pay others to write positive reviews, but nobody is going to pay to write negative reviews. Some of the reviews on this item were mixed, but I bought it anyway. I hung a 40 inch Samsung 4K on the wall in front of my treadmill. The piece which attaches to the set was easy to remove from the articulating arm and easily mounted to the Samsung TV. The hardware was more than sturdy enough to support this size TV. My only wish is that is would have been made in America instead of China.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: So nice we bought it twice
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for an older 32" TV in our living room. It was easy to install and seems very sturdy. We followed one reviewers notes that it was better to use a 3/16" drill bit, which turned out to be solid advice. When we replaced our old 32" with a new 55", we bought the same mounting kit again and only had to put a new mounting plate on the bigger TV; we were able to attach it to the previously installed arm with no trouble. We'll send the rest of the kit with the old TV to a friend so she can mount it on the wall if she likes.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Used this to mount my Roku TVL 43" TV
customer_reviews.text: It comes with an unbelievable number of mounting screws to cover a number of potential TV mounts. The sad part of this is numerous unused bolts, screws etc. In any case, I managed to mount it successfully after locating the wall studs. It was a corner mount and I viewed a number of in stall videos which were a great help. Reasonably priced, too. It was recommended for my Roku TV which was another reason for me to buy it. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: A decent wall mount.
customer_reviews.text: This wall mount was used to mount my 46" Samsung 6150 TV on a bedroom wall. It fit the TV but was a little difficult to find the right holes, there is a good amount of set up that needs to be done to find the right fit. Also I had to jury rig the mounting bolts with bolts I had from another mount that I was replacing from a smaller TV as the bolts supplied were too long and the others too short. Also the tilt function requires a wrench VS having an adjustable handle. A minor annoyance but could have easily made that function easier with a handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: Great mount
customer_reviews.text: Honestly seems a little underpriced. The mount alone is worth the asking price, but then you have the tools, and all the extra hardware. Takes about 10 minutes to bolt it to the wall, attach the plate to the TV, then hang it, at least for a 200x200 VESA TV. A little longer if you have to attach the extensions. We have an awkward corner where the TV sits. The wider feet placement on most new TVs wouldn't fit on the furniture we used with center stand TVs, so this is a perfect solution. Still need to add an outlet behind the TV and run the cables through the wall, but very happy with the mount.
customer_reviews.author: burcs

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy, versatile mount for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This mount worked out very well for my 55" television. My only complaint was that it would be impossible to put the tv on the mount without two people. Most mounts have a sort of "hook on" style that holds the tv in place while you secure it with a safety bar. This one had to be held in line with the screw holes while I reached behind and inserted a long bolt. It worked out just fine, but it was hard to perfectly align the part of the bracket that was attached to the tv to the part that is attached to the wall. Good thing it won't be coming down any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: Wheelin' Willy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mount.  Vastly prefer it to non-articulating mounts.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with my new Sony XBR55X850D (55") TV. Easy to install, fits pretty tight to the wall, allows the TV to be tilted, or remain parallel to the wall. I don't use the articulating arm feature often, but it sure is great when I need to access the connections on the back of the TV. I recently installed a 2nd XBR55 in my guest room with a fixed Cheetah mount and am regretting it. Not horrible, but assembly and mounting was harder and a non-articulating mount makes access to the back a real hassle. I will go with the VideoSecu for any future flat panel mountings.
customer_reviews.author: lush

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very secure
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install a 43 inch TV in my basement office. The install process is very simple but you will need a stud finder!!! It took me about 15 minutes to install this unit. The plate that attaches to the TV is extremely adjustable and I would assume is compatible with nearly any make and model. This mount has a nice low profile, so your TV isn't sticking off of the wall like a sore thumb. I will definitely buy again when we redo our living room! So far I am very pleased, I have swiveled and tilted this unit without any concerns, everything feels very secure.
customer_reviews.author: HumanIcicle

customer_reviews.title: Leveling changes as TV rotates
customer_reviews.text: The product included everything needed to easily assemble. The problem is that when you level the tv against the wall, that level condition is lost as you pull the tv out and rotate it. The pins in the linkage are rotating somehow so the TV is out of level by a LOT - like 5-10 degrees!! This means you can not articulate it- you have to level it in one position and not touch it. This defeats the purpose. I cannot return it because I got rig of all the packaging. Ugh. A waste of $58.
customer_reviews.author: S Kett

customer_reviews.title: Same low price as in Sept - I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: This is MUCH better than what's at Best Buy, so I got another one for the TV I am putting in the garage, I paid $30 at best buy to save time, got home and found out it is not adjustable, oh no! I have to take it back and wait to this one-- 3 whole days - Thanks for the reasonable deal! got these as well "Datacomm 50-3323-WH-KIT Flat Panel TV Cable Organizer" & "2-Port Bi-Directional Cable TV HDTV Amplifier Splitter Signal Booster with Passive Return Path".
customer_reviews.author: Nan Ftokoe

customer_reviews.title: had to alter it for it to work, and now i worry it wont hold my tv
customer_reviews.text: I have a 65 inch Visio. Bought this mount thinking it would work but my studs are too far apart to mount it on the wall. too late to return it so I had to "alter" it to secure it to my wall. It still seems so wobbly Im scared to move it at all for fear it will fall off the wall. very unhappy with this mount, wish it had been more clear about requirements to use before I bought it. not sturdy enough for a large tv in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to mount. Impossible to have it be both flat to wall and centered well.
customer_reviews.text: Very ha d to mount. If it is mounted and you want tv to be centered when against the wall you must off center the bracket. My installation guys did not. Now I have a tv that is off three inches to one side even though the bracket is squarely centered above our fireplace. update: I think I'm going to have to say that after having this up and having several people look at this, there is NO way to center this thing when it is all the way pushed back to the wall. It wasn't that expensive a piece, but paying two guys to uninstall and reinstall will be about 300. More than I paid for the danged TV!
customer_reviews.author: Pejutah

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but it does the job
customer_reviews.text: This mount was definitely tricky to install but I couldn't be more proud of the quality. I wouldn't mount anything past 45 inches on it but the range of motion is your basic left to right. You can also adjust it inward or outward from the wall if you're busy in your room and want to view it up close. It does go up and down but just slightly, aside from that, I think it's everything you need in a normal wall mount if you're looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: William Santos-Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great mount. Lots of versatility
customer_reviews.text: Great mount. Lots of versatility. If this doesn't fit your tv, you're doing it wrong because this thing comes with every adaptation one could think of. My only complaint would have to be that the screw stripped super easy, very cheap metal. But they have a hex outer perimeter, so I was able to use a socket instead of a driver bit to finish what the drill started.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Missing bolts
customer_reviews.text: This product no longer include m5x30 or m4x30 bolts you will need to hang smaller TVs. Previously I purchased this and it did include those. However the decided to inconvenience you and save 20 cents. The actual articulating mount is nice, however the removed the hand adjustable parts and now all parts require tools :(. Why did you do this? If you purchase this I hope you have a complete tool set and large assortment of bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a 50" set- ideal for just using one 2x4 stud to screw into- great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these mounts that I have used. The bracket fit my 50" TCL set fine and the instructions are pretty straightforward. It comes with plenty of hardware to use, and the magnetic level is a nice touch and a great leftover tool to have. I was able to mount it and then install the set by myself due to the cleaver system they use. Is fairly adjustable too.
customer_reviews.author: SLC Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not mounted yet...
customer_reviews.text: Anyone else having this issue with their TV and this mount? It's blocking the video input on my tv LG 50" fl6100 Kind of a big deal
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaZ

customer_reviews.title: Great mount, universal coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's TV in the bedroom. She had full left knee replacement surgery and could no longer get up into our bed. She slept in the guest room and I bought her a TV, but I thought it should be mounter on the wall for better functionality in the room. I received it promptly and had it mounted to the wall with some difficulty in finding the beams to screw into to mount the TV mount. After several moments of figuring I got it mounted to the wall and the base mounted to the TV. Works great and helped her to be a little more comfortable during her recovery time.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very good - coming down soon!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this wall mount for a 46" TV to mount in my son's room. Unfortunately, this mount is going to have to come down. Light touches to this month give a lot of movement, whenever i go to turn on the tv manually i always find myself readjusting the tv for the next min or two because of the huge tilt. A min or two isn't so bad, but when it's a necessary thing to do - it's annoying. Furthermore, being that this is for my young son's room - this is not something i want to take the risk of falling.
customer_reviews.author: brandon smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new 42" TV and wanted a wall mount so I could swing the TV out of the way when not is use. This mount works perfectly. I did it as a 1-person job. You can easily do this single handed. My only concern was there seemed to be a lot of extra parts left over once I was done. I'm guessing it has all the parts for many varieties of installations. TV hasn't fallen off yet - so it must be right. In fact this mount fee;ls like it could hold a tank up. Very solid. Price WAY better than what the big-box home improvement stores have.
customer_reviews.author: John Wolnisty

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a second o e because the first one went up so easy and all screws where provided, however, the second one was a real pain-there were no wood screws provided and had to Mickey Mouse up the screws for the rear of my by. Supposedly provided. Nothing more frustrating to NOT have the proper tools/items needed-worse yet not to realize it until you are in mid install and the screws in the package are NOT what supposed to be. So in a nutshell, great product for the money if all that’s promised is included. It’s a crapshoot gamble on what you’ll get-head to Home Depot first
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The level of quality is low...
customer_reviews.text: I have installed about 30 TVs in my time, including several of this brand. This one was by far the worst. Installed just fine, but when leveled up against the wall, it would come out of level about 1.5in when pulled away from the wall. I eventually found the problem to be a crooked weld on the arm. Will be returning shortly. Disappointed as I have had great luck with other VideoSecu mounts... several of which were this exact model!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Rickabaugh

customer_reviews.title: A few drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Product seems sturdy enough. As easy as any to install. Two large cons to this product that would prevent me from ever buying again: The lag bolts provided Are very cheap quality. A bolt broke in the stud even after I predrilled. The tilt lever is to long, preventing the unit from fully collapsing on itself. In order to fully collapse unit, I had to tighten the bolts then take an angle grinder and remove the extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Woad

customer_reviews.title: Built to Chinese standards
customer_reviews.text: This TV mount is build to disgustingly low quality standards, typical of Chinese manufacturing. As you can see in my attached photo, the arms are welded WAY off from square. This means if the TV is mounted square with the arm collapsed, it will be crooked when the arm is extended. The hardware is also soft garbage, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Its OK, does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and undamaged. Does the job, nice motion range. If it had included a little stud finder instead of a level and little sturdier mounting screws it would've warranted a 5 star. But, I am completely satisfied with it. Took me less than 45 min to install (would've been faster with the level/stud finder switch) Just wish they had used hardened screws for the actual mounting screws. Once they were close to being seated in the wall they began to strip out. If I ever need to move the thing, I will have to replace those cheap self-tapping screws. Other than those couple small things it is a pretty solid mount.
customer_reviews.author: A Crews

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install: the instructions were clear, all the pieces were there, it is definitely universal, and it was very easy to hang the TV on it once all the hardware was installed. Some people have said some screws broke, and while they did look a little cheap, I didn't personally have any issues so I'm not taking points off for that. It's getting 4 stars instead of 5 because there's a lot of flex. I think much of that is because of the plastic backing on the TV, but I still think a more solid mount would reduce that.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price for my 40" wall mounted TV
customer_reviews.text: I used this to support a 40" 2018 Samsung flat panel TV. The price and quality are excellent. The kit includes everything that you need, except the screw driver. It has a variety of hardware to support various TVs. Something to keep in mind: this is a single stud wall mount and the house stud determines where the bracket goes, which is also the pivot point. For me this was an issue because I wanted it to sit nearly flush with the wall and between a window and dresser mirror so I was limited on the side-to-side adjustment (basically, there isn't much).
customer_reviews.author: LaserBill

customer_reviews.title: Light or heavy, older or newer,  they have you covered!
customer_reviews.text: Love these things so much I bought one to hang Mom's TV on the wall even though she wasn't quite sure she would like it. Well, she loves it as much as I do mine. Using 32" TV's with different mounting schemes on back of TV's and it holds them rock solid to the walls. Can't go wrong IMHO, because these mounts have no problem at all whether ordering for a newer TV, such as my light as a feather 32" Vizio, or my heavy 4+ year old Vizio which I gave to Mom (1080p with excellent picture, as usual for Vizio). Also, love the feature in which you can straighten the TV if not level. Got to love engineers!!!
customer_reviews.author: TIMMY!!

customer_reviews.title: All parts included for multiple installment methods!
customer_reviews.text: I have given this 5 stars in all categories because EVERYTHING was included for multiple mounting solutions and for the ease of installing, by myself! I installed into a concrete block wall and did not have to go out or purchase additional tools, screws, or anchors. As I said, it's all there including a small level. After screwing mount into wall and attaching plate to my TV, I was able to use the hooks on the plate which held the TV, while I finished securing the screws. It took me about 30 minutes, including the predrill for anchors. This was all done while my husband was NAPPING!
customer_reviews.author: Parkers Pond

customer_reviews.title: First unit missing hardware.  Second was fine.
customer_reviews.text: The first unit had zero screws, drywall anchors - the whole package was missing. Returned it through Amazon and just ordered another. The second was perfectly fine. Installation was easy for anybody who has messed with mounts before. The articulation on the wall is pretty good for what I need. The arms themselves provide enough surface area for me to zip-tie all the cables and equipment behind the TV for a clean appearance while still being able to articulate in all directions. A nice little unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dreston

customer_reviews.title: Instructions?????
customer_reviews.text: I found this mount to be very sturdy and well constructed. I found that on an LG the mount bracket didn’t fit the vesa 300 x 300. I modified the lower bracket and cut off a few inches and perfectly fit, small modification. Now my way of doing it might be incorrect to the way that the manufacturer would recommend but the instructions are useless that was the only downside, but he most of us don’t really read them until it won’t fit, lol. Anyway it is holding a 55 inch LG with no problems and adjustments are great
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough on the main piece that connects to the tv. The extension part
customer_reviews.text: Seriously disappointed!!! Screws are not long enough to hold!!! Or 50” tv fell and now the screen is completely black!!!!!!!! I’m so livid right now!!! You need longer screws for the backing to hold that main piece that goes onto the tv! So disappointed (My nice way of saying extremely mad) now were out a tv $350 tv!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, very sturdy, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought the VideoSecu wall mount to mount a 32" TV in a bedroom. I was expecting a basic mount and some screws, but was blown away by the thoughtfulness in what came in the box. The package included several different screw size options for various TVs, a magnetic stud-finder, a level, a tool to loosen/tighten the bolts on the mount, a 6" HDMI cable, mounting bracket extenders for larger TVs, and a very sturdy mount. The instructions were crystal clear and the entire process was super simple. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Best TV wall mount we have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: By far the best TV wall bracket we have ever owned. And, we have owned 15. Not because we own 15 TV's, but because so many failed to perform as described or promised. We replaced a wall mount that was designed for sets up to 70". We have only a 55" and it sagged badly when extended, over 3 inches. This mount has no sag and the extension and collapse are smooth as silk. Our TV feels absolutely secure and doesn't even wiggle during movement. Easy to mount on back of TV and then lift onto bracket. We set it way to one side to allow for almost 90 degree turn and it worked perfectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R3

customer_reviews.title: What you expect for 25$ 👎
customer_reviews.text: This mount seems ok. The reason I’m returning it and giving a low rating is because it doesn’t tell you that the mounting point (where it screws to the wall) is Off Center from where the TV’s center is going to be. Therefore if you’re looking to use this mount for a location that has a specific spot it needs to be in this mount is no good. It’s only really good for a caddy corner situation or an application where the TV doesn’t need to be in a specific spot to look right. Also I had to buy different screws for my TV because they didn’t have the right length screws in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic system, different level extended and collapsed
customer_reviews.text: This system is fantastic and has such a wide variety of hardware to help work with all potential mounting requirements. The thing I was surprised, and delighted most, was that tools were included including a level to help with installation. The main issue we have found is that when the TV is against the wall it not level, but when pulled away from the wall it is level. The bracket isn't moving at all at the wall point from what I can tell so we aren't quite sure what is causing this odd issue.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Secure!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 5 of these brackets at different times because it is so great; a couple for us, our son, and most recently for a Florida house, and they are all different size tvs. This bracket is made to place on a stud. Just two holes and easy tv hanging. The arm has great mobility and even slants up or down. Best tv hanger and you cannot beat the price!!! Highly recommend this tv bracket.
customer_reviews.author: trixieboo

customer_reviews.title: Great Wall Mount - easy install and great versatility
customer_reviews.text: This mount was recommended to buy when I bought the tcl tv from amazon as well. Was very happy with it. Mounted easily for the tv and is very versatile. Does not take up much space, can swivel and rotate up and down with ease. Holds the weight it’s supposed to and install was quick and seamless. No regrets. The technician doing the install (also from amazon) likewise said it was a great mount and even took the box it was in to recommend it to other customers. Very happy with this mount overall. Would def recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sliderguy

customer_reviews.title: No left/right adjustability
customer_reviews.text: The anchor mounts to one stud only, and to hold well MUST find a stud. The armature is fixed to that, with neither left/right nor up/down freedom... you can mount it as high as you want on the stud, but can't move left/right. Depending on your TV, you MAY be able to mount the plate to the TV in whatever location you need to center the TV where you want it. But not on my TV, where there are only four anchors and they match the four corners of the plate. So, I lose: I can't mount the TV where I need it, because the stud isn't in exactly the right spot for this mount kit.
customer_reviews.author: Freeland

customer_reviews.title: Woo hoo! It includes a level!
customer_reviews.text: That’s right - that tiny level I don’t have is included. Solid and well made. Includes pads in case the screws are too long. Many screws for different TVs which is a bonus. Thank haven’t gotten it up yet - my son has my good drill. That brat! I’m going to hang a little 32” tv on it in my room and it swivels well. It’s a bit stiff, probably because it’s new......if it’s still stiff to turn after a while - there’s always WD-40 right? The directions are great and simple - and the font is big enough I didn’t even have to hunt down a pair of glasses (which were on my head anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dee

product_meta.title: VideoSecu MW380B5 Full Motion Articulating TV Wall Mount Bracket for Most 37"-70" LED LCD Plasma HDTV Up to 125 lbs with VESA 684x400 600x400 400x400 150x100mm, Dual Arm Pulls Out Up to 14" AW9
feature_bullets: Articulating arm TV wall mount fits 37" 40" 42" 46" 47" 50" 52" 55" 58" 60" 62" 63" 65" 70" LCD LED Plasma display; Mounting hole pattern compatible from 150x100 200x200 300x300 300x200 400x200 400x300 400x400 600x400 684x300 684x400mm
Supports display up to 125 lbs; Adjustable tilt +5/-12 degrees and swivel 160 degrees side-to-side for comfortable viewing angle
Arm fold less than 3" or extend 14" from wall ; +/-3 degrees Post-installation level adjustment allows the TV to perfectly level
Fit 16 inch apart wood studs; Free HDMI cable and standard mounting screws included
